p: ACE2 was identified as the functional receptor to enter into a cell for SARS-CoV-2, which is present in multiple human organs, including the nervous system and skeletal muscles. Patients with severe COVID-19 disease had muscle breakdown causing muscle weakness and this manifested as elevated creatine kinase and lactate dehydrogenase levels than those without muscle symptoms. Apart from the direct tissue injury by the virus, cytokine storm damage [ 42] might also be the other reason for muscle involvement with COVID-19.
